name: Pebble Beach Golf Links
description: One of the most famous public courses in the world
notes: Iconic oceanside links featuring stunning clifftop holes. Host of multiple U.S. Opens.

name: Spyglass Hill Golf Course
description: Challenging course with beautiful forest and ocean views
notes: Robert Trent Jones Sr. design combining coastal dunes and forest. First five holes offer ocean views.

name: Pine Beach East
description: Championship course with scenic lake views
notes: Classic Minnesota resort course with scenic Gull Lake views. Strategic bunkering throughout.

name: Pine Beach West
description: Classic resort course suitable for all skill levels
notes: Family-friendly resort course featuring gentle elevation changes and forgiving fairways.

name: TPC Myrtle Beach
description: Former host of the Senior PGA Tour Championship
notes: Tom Fazio design with tour-caliber conditions. Challenging layout with water features on 10 holes.

name: Dunes Golf and Beach Club
description: Robert Trent Jones Sr. masterpiece
notes: Historic design with the famous 'Waterloo' par-5 13th hole wrapping around Lake Singleton.

name: Caledonia Golf & Fish Club
description: Built on a historic rice plantation
notes: Mike Strantz masterpiece with live oaks draped in Spanish moss framing the fairways.

name: Barefoot Resort - Love Course
description: Davis Love III's tribute to the Lowcountry
notes: Features recreated ruins of an old plantation home. Wide fairways and challenging green complexes.

name: Ocean Course at Kiawah Island
description: Pete Dye's masterpiece and host of the 2021 PGA Championship. Known for its seaside setting and challenging winds.
notes: Ranked #1 public course in South Carolina. All 18 holes offer views of the Atlantic Ocean. Host of the 1991 Ryder Cup and 2012/2021 PGA Championships.

name: Wild Dunes Links Course
description: Tom Fazio's first solo design, featuring stunning coastal holes and challenging seaside winds.
notes: Spectacular finishing holes along the Atlantic Ocean. Recently renovated with new salt-tolerant grass and enhanced bunkers.

name: Patriots Point Links
description: Harbor-side municipal course offering stunning views of Charleston Harbor and the city skyline.
notes: Best value course in Charleston area. Views of Fort Sumter, Charleston Harbor, and the USS Yorktown aircraft carrier.

name: Charleston National Golf Club
description: Rees Jones design weaving through marshland and coastal forest.
notes: Premium public access course with numerous holes along the Intracoastal Waterway. Known for excellent course conditions and challenging layout.

name: RiverTowne Country Club
description: Arnold Palmer signature design along the Wando River.
notes: Beautiful Palmer design featuring marsh and river views. Multiple holes along the Wando River provide scenic challenges.

name: Whistling Straits - Straits Course
description: Pete Dye masterpiece along Lake Michigan, host of the 2021 Ryder Cup
notes: Features eight holes hugging Lake Michigan, nearly 1,000 bunkers, and stunning coastal views.

name: Whistling Straits - Irish Course
description: Inland companion to the Straits course with links-style features
notes: More forgiving than its sister course but still a stern test with grassland and dunes.

name: Bethpage Black
description: A.W. Tillinghast masterpiece and public U.S. Open venue
notes: Warning sign at first tee: The Black Course is an extremely difficult course which we recommend only for highly skilled golfers.

name: TPC Sawgrass - THE PLAYERS Stadium Course
description: Home of THE PLAYERS Championship and the famous island green 17th hole
notes: Features one of golfs most famous holes - the island green 17th. Stadium design allows excellent viewing for tournaments.

name: Streamsong Red
description: Coore & Crenshaw design featuring dramatic elevation changes
notes: Built on sand dunes from former phosphate mining, offering firm and fast conditions.

name: Streamsong Blue
description: Tom Doak design intertwined with the Red course
notes: Features large greens and dramatic bunkering in a links-style setting.

name: Streamsong Black
description: Gil Hanse design on expansive, windswept property
notes: Newest addition to the resort featuring massive greens and bold contours.

name: Sand Valley
description: Designed by Coore & Crenshaw, featuring dramatic sand dunes and strategic options
notes: Walking-only course with stunning elevation changes and wide fairways

name: Mammoth Dunes
description: David McLay Kidd design with massive fairways and bold features
notes: Known for its enormous fairways and creative design elements

name: Sea Island Golf Club - Seaside Course
description: Links-style championship course along the Atlantic Ocean
notes: Host of the PGA Tours RSM Classic, featuring coastal views and challenging sea breezes.

name: The Links at Spanish Bay
description: Iconic golf course with scenic views
notes: Meandering among sweeping sand dunes along 17-Mile Drive, The Links at Spanish Bay unveils some of the most spectacular seaside views in Pebble Beach.

name: The Lido
description: Faithful recreation of the historic Lido Golf Club
notes: Private club recreating the legendary C.B. Macdonald design

name: Seaside Course
description: Host of the PGA TOUR's RSM Classic, this seaside links course offers stunning coastal views and challenging sea breezes
notes: Tom Fazio redesign with coastal views and challenging sea breezes. Host of PGA TOUR's RSM Classic.

name: Plantation Course
description: Recently redesigned by Davis Love III and his brother Mark, offering a strategic test through coastal forests
notes: Completely renovated in 2019 with modern features while maintaining its historic character

name: Retreat Course
description: Davis Love III design perfect for all skill levels, featuring wide fairways and strategic challenges
notes: Most forgiving of Sea Island's courses, perfect for resort players of all abilities

name: The Old White
description: C.B. Macdonald masterpiece and host of The Greenbrier Classic PGA TOUR event
notes: Opened in 1914, restored to its original design after 2016 flood. Features classic template holes.

name: The Meadows
description: Recently renovated course featuring challenging water hazards and mountain views
notes: Redesigned in 2017 to enhance playability while maintaining challenge

name: The Ashford Short Course
description: Fun and challenging 9-hole walking course perfect for quick rounds
notes: Perfect for families and beginners, or as a warm-up round

name: Great Waters
description: Jack Nicklaus Signature course recently renovated in 2019, featuring dramatic lakefront holes
notes: Spectacular lake views on nine holes, including the entire back nine along Lake Oconee

name: The Oconee
description: Rees Jones design with challenging water features and strategic bunkering
notes: Known for its challenging finishing holes along Lake Oconee

name: The Landing
description: Bob Cupp's first design at Reynolds, featuring rolling terrain and lake views
notes: Original Reynolds course, renovated to maintain modern standards

name: Ozarks National
description: Coore & Crenshaw masterpiece with stunning ridgetop views
notes: Named Best New Public Course by Golf Digest in 2019

name: Buffalo Ridge
description: Tom Fazio design incorporating native beauty and free-ranging buffalo
notes: Features actual buffalo from nearby reserve visible from several holes

name: Top of the Rock
description: Jack Nicklaus-designed par-3 course with spectacular views
notes: World-class practice facility and putting course included with green fee

name: The Broadmoor - East Course
description: The East Course is known for its challenging design by Donald Ross and Robert Trent Jones Sr. It has hosted numerous major championships including the U.S. Women's Open.
notes: Host of multiple USGA championships

name: The Broadmoor - West Course
description: The West Course offers spectacular mountain views and a challenging layout with significant elevation changes and strategic bunkering.
notes: Significant elevation changes throughout the course

name: Grayhawk Golf Club - Raptor Course
description: The Raptor Course at Grayhawk is a challenging desert-style layout designed by Tom Fazio featuring strategic bunkering and water hazards.
notes: Former host of PGA Tour events

name: TPC Scottsdale - Stadium Course
description: Home to the PGA Tour's WM Phoenix Open, this course is famous for its stadium setting at the 16th hole and challenging desert layout.
notes: Home of the WM Phoenix Open

name: We-Ko-Pa Golf Club - Saguaro Course
description: The Saguaro Course at We-Ko-Pa is a minimalist desert design that follows the natural contours of the land with no homes or development in sight.
notes: Ranked among top public courses in Arizona

name: Omni Barton Creek - Fazio Foothills
description: The Fazio Foothills is the signature course at Barton Creek, featuring dramatic elevation changes, rock features, and stunning Hill Country views.
notes: Signature course of the resort, ranked among top courses in Texas

name: Omni Barton Creek - Fazio Canyons
description: The Fazio Canyons course is set in a scenic canyon area with limestone cliffs, streams, and native vegetation creating a dramatic setting for golf.
notes: Former host of Champions Tour events

name: Omni Barton Creek - Coore Crenshaw
description: This course, designed by Ben Crenshaw and Bill Coore, features a more traditional layout with strategic bunkering and subtle green complexes.
notes: Most walkable of the four courses

name: Omni Barton Creek - Palmer Lakeside
description: Located a short drive from the main resort, this Arnold Palmer design offers beautiful views of Lake Travis and the Hill Country.
notes: Located 25 minutes from main resort, overlooking Lake Travis

name: Troon North Golf Club - Monument Course
description: Set in the high Sonoran Desert and winding through natural ravines and foothills, Troon North's Monument Course is one of Arizona's most celebrated layouts.
notes: Features the iconic Monument Boulder on the 3rd hole

name: Troon North Golf Club - Pinnacle Course
description: The Pinnacle Course offers a more traditional desert-style layout with generous fairways and challenging approach shots.
notes: Ranked among America's top 100 public courses

name: The Phoenician Golf Club
description: Recently redesigned in 2019, this resort course offers stunning views of Camelback Mountain and downtown Phoenix.
notes: Complete redesign by Phil Smith in 2019

name: McDowell Mountain Golf Club
description: A pure desert golf experience with panoramic views of the McDowell Mountains and Verde River Valley.
notes: Former host of PGA Tour qualifying events

name: Talking Stick Golf Club - O'odham Course
description: A traditional desert-links style course designed by Bill Coore and Ben Crenshaw.
notes: More traditional layout of the two courses

name: Talking Stick Golf Club - Piipaash Course
description: A more straightforward desert course with tree-lined fairways and strategic bunkering.
notes: More player-friendly of the two courses

name: Camelback Golf Club - Ambiente Course
description: A completely renovated layout featuring rolling terrain, strategic bunkering and native desert landscaping.
notes: Ambiente means 'environment' in Spanish

name: Camelback Golf Club - Padre Course
description: A traditional parkland-style layout with mature trees and water features.
notes: Original Arthur Hills design

name: Bethpage Black Course
description: One of the most difficult and well-known public golf courses in America. Host to multiple U.S. Opens, the PGA Championship, and the 2024 Ryder Cup.
notes: Warning sign: 'The Black Course is an extremely difficult course which we recommend only for highly skilled golfers.'

name: Bethpage Red Course
description: The second most challenging course at Bethpage State Park, featuring A.W. Tillinghast's classic design with long par 4s and strategic doglegs.
notes: Often considered the second-best course at Bethpage

name: Bethpage Blue Course
description: A well-balanced layout offering a mix of challenging holes while remaining playable for various skill levels.
notes: Good mix of challenging and forgiving holes

name: Bethpage Green Course
description: The original course at Bethpage State Park, designed to be more forgiving and ideal for novice and casual golfers.
notes: First course built at Bethpage State Park

name: Bethpage Yellow Course
description: The most accessible of Bethpage's five courses, opened in 1958 and designed for enjoyable rounds for all skill levels.
notes: Most forgiving of the five Bethpage courses

name: Peninsula Golf Club
description: A public golf course in Massapequa offering a pleasant round with water views and challenging holes.
notes: Located along the South Shore of Long Island

name: Oyster Bay Golf Course
description: A challenging public course in Woodbury featuring well-maintained fairways and greens with strategic layout.
notes: Popular local course with challenging layout

name: Cantiague Park Golf Course
description: A beginner-friendly 9-hole public course in Hicksville, perfect for casual rounds and learning the game.
notes: Ideal course for beginners and quick rounds
